posts._title: Sol Berruezo Pichon-Riviére – Mamá, mamá, mamá (2020)
posts.title: Mamá, mamá, mamá
posts.excerpt: A veil of sadness lies over the oppressively hot summer days. Cleo dives into daydreams with her cousins, the girls share secret signs and rituals. Flowing gently, in impressionistic images, the empty space that the death of Cleo’s sister has left in the family is poetically encircled.

posts._title: Yôichi Sai – A Sign Days AKA Via Okinawa (1989)
posts.title: A Sign Days
posts.excerpt: Summary:During the Vietnam War era, the influx of American soldiers to Okinawa boosted the local economy and introduced many bars and nightclubs. With exhausting displays of energy, Sai presents a whirlwind romance between a local rocker and the daughter of a mixed American-Okinawan marriage.

posts._title: Nick Grinde – The Man They Could Not Hang (1939)
posts.title: The Man They Could Not Hang
posts.excerpt: When Dr. Savaard’s experiment in cryonics is interrupted by the short-sighted authorities, his volunteer dies, and he is condemned to death. He vows vengeance if he can survive his own hanging.

posts._title: Hélène Chatelain – Néstor Makhno, paysan d’Ukraine AKA Nestor Makhno (1996)
posts.title: Néstor Makhno, paysan d’Ukraine
posts.excerpt: With breathless pace, Hélène Chatelain (“the woman” in “La jetée”) reconstructs the life of Nestor Makhno from his writings, Soviet propaganda films, reactions of workers today and the memory he has left in the hearts & minds of his people in Gouliaïpolié, in the east of the Ukraine.
